item.title: Preparing For The Game At Hand

item.title: Timing Is Everything
item.description: Goal line cutting (especially in the elite division) is a difficult technique to master. The fact is, the closer you get to the endzone, the more effective a defensive player can be because you are shortening the field and removing the threat of a deep cut. In general, the offense always has the advantage, but close to the endzone, your advantage as a cutter is lessened. All organized teams usually have a specific endzone offense that they default to when they get within ten yards or less of the goal line.
